abstract: General Electric said Wellstream had rejected a 755 million pound ($1.2 billion) takeover approach, fueling speculation that Wellstream was talking to other suitors.
snippet: General Electric said Wellstream had rejected a 755 million pound ($1.2 billion) takeover approach, fueling speculation that Wellstream was talking to other suitors.
lead_paragraph: General Electric, the American conglomerate, said Wellstream had rejected a 755 million pound ($1.2 billion) takeover approach, fueling speculation that Wellstream was talking to other suitors, Reuters reports.

headline.main: GE Says Wellstream Rejected $1.2 Billion Bid

abstract: Just a few weeks after selling the student lending business at a $500 million loss, Citigroup agreed to sell about $1.6 billion of private-label credit card loans  to GE Capital.
snippet: Just a few weeks after selling the student lending business at a $500 million loss, Citigroup agreed to sell about $1.6 billion of private-label credit card loans  to GE Capital.
lead_paragraph: Eric Dash, a DealBook colleague, reports:

abstract: The deal for Dresser, a privately held energy infrastructure and services company, is the latest energy deal by G.E. over the last week.
snippet: The deal for Dresser, a privately held energy infrastructure and services company, is the latest energy deal by G.E. over the last week.
lead_paragraph: 6:00 p.m. | Updated General Electric executives have said for months that they would start spending the billions of dollars in cash that the company has been accumulating. That time, it seems, has now come.

headline.main: With Dresser, G.E.’s Just Getting Started

byline.original: By Thomas Kaplan and Michael J. de la Merced
